hyp_text: Multiple Sclerosis (MS) is a chronic, often disabling disease that attacks the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord). MS is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body inappropriately attacks its own tissues. In MS, this immune system malfunction destroys the myelin sheath that surrounds and protects the nerve cells. This damage disrupts the ability of part of the nerve cell to transmit signals, resulting in the loss of nerve function. It was proclaimed in 1898 as the Orange Free State's first nature reserve. The park was established to protect the wildlife of the South African Lowveld. It is one of the largest game reserves in Africa and the world. The park is part of the Great Limpopo Transfrontier Park, a peace park that links Kruger National Park with the Gonarezhou National Park in Zimbabwe, and with the Limpopo National Park in Mozambique. The park has nine main gates allowing entrance to the different camps. The main entrance gate is at Phabeni, 30 km from Hazyview and 40 km from Nelspruit. The park is approximately 360 km long and 65 km wide. It has an area of 19,485 km² (7,523 sq mi) making it the largest game reserve in South Africa. It is larger than Israel and the same size as the country of Switzerland. There are 2 million hectares of wilderness made up of bushveld, woodland, grassland and riverine forest. It has an impressive diversity of life forms and a high degree of endemism – that is, species unique to the region. Its history of conservation stretches back to the late 19th century, and its role in the conservation of African wildlife and ecosystems is historic. The park has been expanded to include the adjacent states of Zimbabwe, Botswana and Mozambique. It is now part of the Great Limpopo Transfrontier Park, a peace park that links Kruger National Park with the Gonarezhou National Park in Zimbabwe, and with the Limpopo National Park in Mozambique. The park is part of the Kruger to Canyons Biosphere an area designated by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) as an International Man and Biosphere Reserve (the "Biosphere"). It is one of the largest areas of protected land on the continent.
